meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Ah, Horizon Chase 2, the game that's got everyone revving their engines and checking out the competition. I'm here to give you the lowdown on this arcade racing sensation, with a side of snark and sass (because, why not?).

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What's the big deal about Horizon Chase 2?" Well, let me tell you - it's got speed, it's got style, and it's got a healthy dose of nostalgia. But is it worth your hard-earned cash? Let's dive in and find out.

First off, the gameplay. Oh boy, is it fast. I mean, we're talking top-tier racing game fast. The sense of speed is infectious - you'll be grinning from ear to ear as you zip past opponents and soar through the finish line. And with tracks designed by some of the best in the business, you know you're in for a wild ride.

Now, I've seen some of my fellow critics say that Horizon Chase 2 is all flash, no substance. But honestly, I think they're just being grumpy old men (or women, or non-binary folks... you get the idea). The game's got depth, with a robust progression system and plenty of secrets to uncover. And let's not forget about multiplayer - it's a blast to compete with friends online.

But what really sets Horizon Chase 2 apart is its sense of style. I mean, this game looks and sounds like a dream come true for retro arcade fans. The graphics are a love letter to the '80s and '90s, with bold colors and chunky pixels that'll transport you back to a time when Pac-Man was king.

Of course, not everyone's a fan of Horizon Chase 2. Player 2 gives it a solid-but-not-spectacular 67 out of 100, citing issues with progression and audio mixing (fair enough - I mean, the sound design is a bit... odd). But hey, even they can't deny the game's infectious energy and addictive gameplay.

In the end, Horizon Chase 2 is a love letter to arcade racing fans everywhere. It's fast, it's fun, and it's got just the right amount of nostalgia to make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside. So if you're looking for a good time, with plenty of speed and style to go around, look no further than Horizon Chase 2.

That is all for now - tune in next time when I'll be reviewing... well, something else!
